description:
Running release number 453. If one starts nova-scheduler they will get a traceback:


        Traceback (most recent call last):
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc.py", line 117, in fetch
            super(Consumer, self).fetch(no_ack, auto_ack, enable_callbacks)
          File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/carrot/messaging.py", line 308, in fetch
            self.receive(message.payload, message)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/exception.py", line 80, in _wrap
            return f(*args, **kw)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc.py", line 200, in receive
            d = defer.maybeDeferred(node_func, context=ctxt, **node_args)
        --- <exception caught here> ---
          File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/twisted/internet/defer.py", line 117, in maybeDeferred
            result = f(*args, **kw)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/scheduler/manager.py", line 62, in _schedule
            host = self.driver.schedule(elevated, topic, *args, **kwargs)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/scheduler/chance.py", line 37, in schedule
            raise driver.NoValidHost("No hosts found")
        nova.scheduler.driver.NoValidHost: No hosts found
title: Running nova-scheduler results in a traceback.

comments.content:
Running release number 453. If one starts nova-scheduler they will get a traceback:


        Traceback (most recent call last):
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc.py", line 117, in fetch
            super(Consumer, self).fetch(no_ack, auto_ack, enable_callbacks)
          File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/carrot/messaging.py", line 308, in fetch
            self.receive(message.payload, message)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/exception.py", line 80, in _wrap
            return f(*args, **kw)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc.py", line 200, in receive
            d = defer.maybeDeferred(node_func, context=ctxt, **node_args)
        --- <exception caught here> ---
          File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/twisted/internet/defer.py", line 117, in maybeDeferred
            result = f(*args, **kw)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/scheduler/manager.py", line 62, in _schedule
            host = self.driver.schedule(elevated, topic, *args, **kwargs)
          File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/scheduler/chance.py", line 37, in schedule
            raise driver.NoValidHost("No hosts found")
        nova.scheduler.driver.NoValidHost: No hosts found
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zulcss

comments.content: "No hosts found" is expected if nova-compute isn't running..
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content: Can't reproduce that. Could you check with current builds ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: nova-scheduler runs fine for me, also moved to eventlet so probably no longer relevant.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
